title: Territory Sales Executive Job at Oracle
content:
Oracle provides the world's most complete, open, and integrated business software and hardware systems, with more than 370,000 customers including 100 of the Fortune 100 representing a variety of sizes and industries in more than 145 countries around the globe.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Territory Sales Executive

Job Identification: 288618
Job Location: Lagos
Job Category: Sales
Role: Individual Contributor
Job Type: Regular Employee

Job Description
What you will do:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Primary job duty is to sell HCM, ERP, EPM and SCM cloud solutions and related services to prospective and existing Oracle customers, driving increased revenues of our Cloud SaaS Applications across different accounts within your territory.
	Winning new SaaS cloud revenue in HCM, ERP, EPM and SCM.
	Generating and following up on leads, qualifying leads, and prioritizing opportunities.
	Identifying and working with the appropriate people in Oracle and the Customer.
	Developing a strategy and sales plan to address the designated territory coverage. (FSI and Manufacturing)
	Driving the implementation of sales campaigns
	Working with and influencing the activities of Oracle Partners as appropriate.
	Maintaining a complete and up-to-date understanding of competition in HCM, ERP, EPM and SCM line, and able to influence the sales process for developing proactive and counter actions for winning the deal.


Responsibilities


	Primary job duty is to sell business applications software/solutions and related services to prospective and existing customers.
	Manage sales through forecasting, account resource allocation, account strategy, and planning.
	Develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application.
	Participate in the development, presentation and sales of a value proposition.
	Negotiate pricing and contractual agreement to close the sale. Identify and develop strategic alignment with key third party influencers.


Requirements
What we are looking for:


	Career Level - IC4 
	At least 7 years of experience in Enterprise Sales
	Strong relationships with C-Level across key Industries ie FSI, Telco, Government, Healthcare, Education etc
	Demonstrated success in consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets in previous roles.
	Ability to understand and articulate complex software solutions and their benefits to potential clients.
	Capability to develop and implement strategic sales plans to penetrate target markets and industries effectively.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to deliver compelling presentations and negotiate contracts.
	Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
	Flexibility to adapt to changing market conditions, client requirements, and product offerings.


What we will offer you


	A competitive salary with exciting benefits
	Learning and development opportunities to advance your career.
	An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health.
	Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities
	Core benefits such as life insurance, and access to retirement planning
	An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique


Note:


	At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences—we celebrate them.
	We believe that innovation starts with inclusion and to create the future we need people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities.
	That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work.
	It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.

title: Database Administrator (Oracle, MongoDB, Cassandra, MySQL) Job at BlueChip Technologies
content:
BlueChip Technologies is a leading business application firm focused exclusively on assisting organizations in planning, designing, implementing and operating business application solutions and strategies that are central to creating and maintaining a competitive business advantage.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Database Administrator (Oracle, MongoDB, Cassandra, MySQL)

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As part of our growth strategy, we are seeking an experienced and versatile Database Administrator (DBA) with expertise across Oracle, MongoDB, Cassandra, and MySQL to join our dynamic team. 


Role Overview 


	We are looking for a results-driven and detail-oriented Database Administrator to oversee the installation, configuration, performance, and security of our enterprise-grade databases.
	The ideal candidate will bring extensive experience in relational and non-relational database technologies and a solid track record of implementing, maintaining, and optimizing critical data systems in high-availability environments. 


Key Responsibilities
Oracle Database Administration:


	Install, configure, and maintain Oracle 10g/11g/12c/19c in single-instance and clustered environments. 
	Manage Real Application Clusters (RAC), Data Guard, Log Shipping, and Cloning. 
	Execute backup and recovery procedures using RMAN. 
	Monitor and optimize database performance; troubleshoot bottlenecks. 
	Apply security patches, upgrades, and manage database migrations. 
	Ensure compliance with Oracle licensing and security standards. 


MongoDB & MySQL Administration:


	Deploy, configure, and support MongoDB and MySQL databases in production and staging environments. 
	Implement replication, sharding, clustering, and indexing strategies. 
	Optimize performance using profiling tools and query tuning techniques. 
	Design NoSQL schema models in MongoDB for scalable applications. 
	Perform backup and restore using MongoDB Ops Manager and MySQL tools. 


Cassandra Administration (Optional but Preferred):


	Install and maintain Cassandra clusters. 
	Manage high-volume writes and reads, ensuring horizontal scalability. 
	Configure replication, consistency levels, and monitor cluster health. 


General DBA Functions:


	Develop and implement robust backup, restore, and disaster recovery strategies. 
	Conduct routine health checks and failover drills. 
	Handle P1/P2 incident escalations and change management processes. 
	Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams for data modeling and integration. 
	Ensure accurate documentation of configurations and processes. 


Qualifications & Requirements 


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related discipline. 
	Minimum of 7 years hands-on experience managing Oracle, MongoDB, Cassandra, and MySQL databases. 
	Strong expertise in: 
	Oracle RAC, RMAN, and performance tuning. 
	MongoDB and MySQL replication, clustering, and schema design. 
	NoSQL performance optimization and disaster recovery planning. 
	Proficiency in SQL, PL/SQL, and NoSQL query languages. 
	Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is highly desirable. 
	Certifications such as: 
	
		Oracle Certified Professional (OCP) 
		MongoDB Certified DBA 
		MySQL Certified DBA; are a strong plus. 
	
	
	Excellent analytical, troubleshooting, and documentation skills. 
	Strong communication and teamwork abilities. 


What We Offer 


	Competitive and performance-driven salary package. 
	Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance. 
	Pension and retirement savings plan with company contributions. 
	Continuous learning and development opportunities. 
	A collaborative, innovative, and inclusive work environment. 
	Flexible working arrangements and modern office facilities.

title: Cloud & AI Infrastructure Sales Executive (Public Sector & FSI) Job at Oracle
content:
Oracle provides the world's most complete, open, and integrated business software and hardware systems, with more than 370,000 customers, including 100 of the Fortune 100, representing a variety of sizes and industries in more than 145 countries around the globe.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cloud & AI Infrastructure Sales Executive (Public Sector & FSI)

Job Identification: 279176
Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) & Lagos
Job Category: Sales
Role: Individual Contributor
Job Type: Regular Employee

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oracle is at the forefront of the digital transformation, empowering businesses with cutting-edge AI and Cloud Infrastructure solutions, encompassing both Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS).
	We’re looking for a Cloud & AI Infrastructure Sales Executive to drive force behind advancing customer missions through the power of Oracle's comprehensive cloud portfolio.


What you will do:


	Engage in strategic C-level conversations to uncover cloud transformation opportunities while conducting in-depth needs assessments and solution demonstrations. 
	You will collaborate with technical experts to craft tailored cloud proposals and negotiate complex contracts, and ensure seamless deal execution by:
	
		Evangelizing Oracle's Cloud Vision: Become a trusted advisor to C-level executives, demonstrating how Oracle's AI and Cloud Infrastructure solutions can transform their businesses and drive unprecedented success.
		Leading Transformational Deals: Orchestrate complex sales cycles, navigating technical intricacies and securing buy-in from multiple stakeholders.
		Scaling Cloud Adoption Across Industries: Identify high-potential opportunities across diverse sectors, tailoring Oracle's cloud solutions to address unique challenges.
		Forging Strategic Partnerships: Collaborate with Oracle's partner ecosystem to expand market reach and deliver comprehensive cloud solutions.
		Being a Champion for Customer Success: Ensure seamless implementation and adoption of Oracle's cloud technology, fostering long-term customer relationships.
	
	


Responsibilities
Your Experience:


	Proven Sales Acumen: several years of enterprise software/cloud sales experience, with a track record of exceeding targets and closing multi-million-dollar deals.
	C-Level Engagement: Demonstrated ability to build relationships and influence senior executives across various industries.
	Cloud Passion and Expertise: Deep understanding of cloud technologies (IaaS, PaaS, AI) and their potential applications across different business functions.
	Technical Fluency: Ability to articulate complex technical concepts in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.
	Customer-Centric Approach: Unwavering commitment to understanding customer needs and delivering exceptional value.


Oracle's Cloud Advantage:


	Industry Leadership: Oracle's cloud solutions are recognized for their innovation, security, and scalability.
	Unmatched Data Security: Oracle's unique approach to data security ensures customer data remains protected throughout the cloud journey.
	Customer-Centric Focus: Oracle is committed to partnering with customers to achieve their cloud goals and drive long-term success.
	Culture of Innovation: Oracle fosters a collaborative environment where employees are encouraged to push boundaries and unleash their full potential.
	Comprehensive Portfolio: Oracle offers a complete suite of cloud solutions, including IaaS, PaaS, and AI, providing customers with a one-stop shop for their digital transformation needs.


Qualifications


	Career Level - IC4.


What we will offer you


	A competitive salary with exciting benefits
	Flexible working so you can do your best work
	Learning and development opportunities to advance your career
	An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health
	Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities
	Core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning
	An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique.

title: Lead, Industry Engagement and Employer Network Job at Mastercard Foundation
content:
Mastercard Foundation is a global foundation based across four hubs in Kigali, Rwanda, Nairobi, Kenya, Accra, Ghana and Toronto, Canada. Our programs promote financial inclusion and advance education and learning in Africa, primarily for young people, and in Canada for Indigenous youth. The Foundation was established in 2006 through the generosity of Mastercard when it became a public company. From inception, the Foundation was designed to be a separate entity and independent from Mastercard. Our policies, operations, and funding decisions are made by our President and Board of Directors.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



The Foundation believes that youth employment is key to unlocking prosperity, both for youth and their societies. Enabling young women and men from disadvantaged communities to secure dignified and fulfilling work will ensure inclusive development and economic growth in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Lead, Industry Engagement and Employer Network

Job Requisition ID: JR-0000000298
Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time

The Opportunity


	The Lead, Industry Engagement and Employer Network is responsible for executing and managing industry engagement initiatives within the Associate program for tertiary graduates and other placement programs by the Transitions team.
	This role will focus on operationalizing employer engagement, maintaining relationships with industry partners, and supporting the execution of employer-driven initiatives.
	The individual will also contribute to the design and implementation of the placement program for non-tertiary graduates.
	Working closely with country teams, internal stakeholders, and employer partners, the Lead will ensure that industry engagement activities align with program goals and create meaningful employment opportunities


Responsibilities
Ways You can Contribute:


	Support the establishment and management of a robust employer network to connect industry leaders with Associates and create job opportunities.
	Execute employer outreach, onboarding, and engagement activities to ensure strong alignment between employer needs and program objectives.
	Act as a key liaison for employer stakeholders, ensuring consistent communication and coordination of engagement efforts.
	Coordinate with internal teams (e.g., Scholars, Alumni & Youth Engagement) to align employer engagement efforts with broader program initiatives.
	Collect, track, and analyze employer-related data within the Associate program to assess program effectiveness and inform improvements.
	Prepare reports on employer engagement trends and program performance for internal stakeholders.
	Work with the Associate engagement team to support the implementation of standardized learning experiences for Associates across regions.
	Support the execution of the placement program for non-tertiary graduates by coordinating with industry partners, employers, and country teams.
	Assist in identifying employer needs and ensuring alignment between program offerings and market demands.
	Provide logistical and administrative support for placement activities, including tracking participation and ensuring smooth program execution.
	Coordinate engagement efforts with internal teams and external partners to facilitate seamless execution of employer engagement initiatives.
	Work collaboratively to ensure alignment between employer-led initiatives and broader workforce development programs.
	Support advocacy efforts by maintaining strong employer relationships and ensuring engagement strategies align with program goals.


Requirements


	Minimum of ten (7-9) years of  progressive experience in employer engagement, program management, or strategic partnership roles, workforce development, or a related sector.
	Experience in engaging with employer associations, civil society organizations, government, private sector etc., as well as young people.
	Managing multiple projects and delivering results in a fast-paced and fluid environment. 
	Experience in designing and delivering leadership development programs for young people, in Africa.
	Experience with global grant making. This experience may come from working in another funding organization, corporation, government or an NGO. 
	Experience working across cultures and geographies, living and working in Africa is highly desirable
	Flexible, adaptable, and able to execute a range of job duties and changing priorities.
	Possess excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills with the ability to articulate information to a variety of constituents across cultures.
	Possess professional maturity, sensitivity with different cultures, and impeccable integrity
